channel.title: Should i upgrade to visual studio 2008
channel.description: I have been wondering whether to upgrade to visual studio 2008 instead of 2005. Is it worth upgrading to visual studio 2008? Post your reasons why it is or why it isn't.

item.title: Should i upgrade to visual studio 2008
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

It’s very nice. However, it could ruin your life. So be sure to go to Tools->Options->Debugging->Just-In-Time->Uncheck everything. Essentially this stops VS from debugging EVERY time a process crashes, even unmanged native assemblies.
The main benefit is XAML and WPF support, in my opinion. There is also the ability to add SilverLight project functionality.

Read full topic
item.source: Should i upgrade to visual studio 2008

item.title: Should i upgrade to visual studio 2008
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

oo sweet i can compile .net 2.0 and 3.0/3.5.

im gona upgrade to 2008 ty for telling me.

Read full topic
item.source: Should i upgrade to visual studio 2008

item.title: Should i upgrade to visual studio 2008
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Yes, you should. Your applications will be able to use 3.0-/3.5-specific features, and you will still be able to compile to .net 2.0

Read full topic
